alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 10:00PM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated mostly light rain falling across the northern portions of Colleton County. While additional flooding is unlikely, flooding continues in many areas this evening. Be alert for flood roadways. - Water levels along Ireland Creek are slowly rising. If living near the creek, continue to monitor water levels through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton, Cottageville, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Ruffin, Padgetts, Islandton, Canadys, Ashton, Round O, Smyly, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Colleton Medical Center, Caldwell, Lowcountry Regional Airport and Springtown.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
